ECC.jl Documentation

ECC.jl Documentation

Elliptic Curve Cryptography for Julia.

Types

ECC.S256Point — Type.
S256Point{T<:Number}

S256Point(𝑥::T, 𝑦::T) where {T<:Union{S256FieldElement, Integer, Infinity}} represents a point in an scep256k1 field.

ECC.PrivateKey — Type.

PrivateKey(𝑒) represents an S256Point determined by 𝑃 = 𝑒G, where 𝑒 is an integer and G the scep256k1 generator point.

ECC.Signature — Type.

Signature(𝑟, 𝑠) represents a Signature for 𝑧 in which 𝑠 = (𝑧 + 𝑟𝑒) / 𝑘 𝑘 being a random integer.

Functions

ECC.point2sec — Function.

Serialize an S256Point() to compressed SEC format, uncompressed if false is set as second argument.

'point2sec(P::T, compressed::Bool=true) where {T<:S256Point} -> Array{UInt8,1}'

ECC.sec2point — Function.

Parse a SEC binary to an S256Point()

sec2point(sec_bin::AbstractArray{UInt8}) -> S256Point

ECC.verify — Function.

Returns true if Signature is valid for 𝑧 given 𝑃, false if not

verify(𝑃::AbstractPoint, 𝑧::Integer, sig::Signature) -> Bool

ECC.pksign — Function.

Returns a Signature for a given PrivateKey and data 𝑧 pksign(pk::PrivateKey, 𝑧::Integer) -> Signature

ECC.sig2der — Function.

Serialize a Signature to DER format

sig2der(x::Signature) -> Array{UInt8,1}

ECC.der2sig — Function.

Parse a DER binary to a Signature

der2sig(signature_bin::AbstractArray{UInt8}) -> Signature

Helpers

ECC.int2bytes — Function.

Convert Integer to Array{UInt8}

int2bytes(x::Integer) -> Array{UInt8,1}

ECC.bytes2int — Function.

Convert UInt8 Array to Integers

bytes2big(x::Array{UInt8,1}) -> BigInt
